revised_title: Energy Balance and Structure of Solar Active Regions
tldr: The authors discuss the structure and energy balance of solar active regions by analyzing the emission measures calculated from extreme ultraviolet and X-ray line intensities. They develop a general method to derive the temperature and density structure and energy balance in both quiet Sun and active regions. The study also examines the mechanical energy required to balance conductive flux and radiation losses, comparing empirical damping lengths with those expected from conduction damping of sound waves or viscous damping of Alfven waves.
